q:
You are trying to connect your Laravel application with an SQLite database. You are given a table named employee. If you are required to execute the following PHP framework with the respect to the table, then determine its result:

Table: employee

id name salary
101 ABC 10000
102 XYZ 20000
103 ADC 25000
104 LMN 15000

Code

Route::get('/sample',function(){  
$update=DB::update('update employee set name="PQR" where id=?',[103]);
echo $update;
echo "<br/>";
$details=DB::select('select * from employee where name LIKE "A%" ');  
foreach($details as $temp)  
{  
    echo $temp->id;  
    echo "<br/>";  
    echo $temp->salary;
}  
});

Results

1.

101
10000

2.

True
101
10000

3.

False
101
10000

4.

True
101
10000
103
25000

You are working on the default interface Artisan of the Laravel framework. You have created a project named "myproject". Using the command line, you need to perform a few tasks as mentioned below:

Tasks

  1. Command to start "myproject" Laravel project
  2. Create new custom command "mycommand" using the cmd interface
  3. Get the location where the new command is stored

Problem statement

Which of the following options are correct to perform the given tasks:

1.

1. php artisan start 
2. php artisan make:command mycommand 
3. App\Console directory

2.

1. php artisan start 
2. php artisan make:console mycommand 
3. App\Console directory

3.

1. php artisan serve 
2. php artisan make:command mycommand 
3. App\Console\Commands directory

4.

1. php artisan serve 
2. php artisan make:console mycommand 
3. App\Console\Commands directory

Anita is working on error handling in her PHP Laravel web application. If she is required to view the errors and exceptions related to a webpage, then which of the following class paths can contain this information in this scenario?

Alice is working on the controllers from Laravel Framework for her web application. If she is required to create a controller named MyController such that it will make a plain constructor, then which of the following PHP commands can she perform in this scenario:

Commands

1.

php artisan make:controller MyController --plain

2.

php artisan make:controller <MyController> --plain

3.

php artisan make:controller <controller> --plain

4.

php artisan make:controller controller --plain

Mike has developed a Laravel web application. While deploying his application, he has observed that any changes that are implemented in the application are not being reflected in the web interfaces. His senior peer John has added feedback that this happens because the application is being served by the cache. While working with his routes, if Mike is required to clear the route cache, then which of the following PHP commands should he execute in this scenario:

PHP commands

1.

php artisan make:clear

2.

php artisan route:remove

3.

php artisan route:clear

4.

php artisan route:cache-remo

In Laravel, you are working on error handling. Your application is set in debug mode. Detailed error messages with stack traces will be shown on every error that occurs within your web application. Now, if you have set the debug mode from false to true, which of the following can occur in this scenario?

a.option: It will enable the user to view all errors
It will disable the errors and warnings in the application
It will display errors in the webpage and will not allow user to access that page

q:
You are working on PHP Laravel. You are building a website with the name "www.mywebsite.com". There are around 6 web pages that are interlinked. They are index, home, page1, page2, page3, and page4. Now, you have created three middlewares using the artisan command-line interface and make:middleware command. The middlewares are auth, exception, and log. Along with these, you have created a controller class named "mycontroller" which will extend Controller super class. Now, you are required to perform the following tasks:

Tasks

  1. Apply auth middleware to all routes/pages except index and home
  2. Apply log middleware only to page3 route
  3. Apply exception middleware to all routes

Which of the following PHP tasks can you perform to implement the given tasks in the controller code in this scenario:

Code

Class mycontroller extends Controller{
       public function __contruct(){
             //Add your functionality here
       }
}

Options

1.

$this->middleware('auth')->except(['home']);
$this->middleware('log')->only(['page2']);
$this->middleware('exception')->allpages();

2.

$this->middleware('auth')->dont('index',['home']);
$this->middleware('log')->only(['page3']);
$this->middleware('exception')->all();

3.

$this->middleware('auth')->except(['index','home']);
$this->middleware('log')->only(['page3']);
$this->middleware('exception');

4.

$this->middleware('auth')->except(['index','home']);
$this->middleware('log')->onlyfor(['page3']);
$this->middleware('exception');

You are working on PHP Laravel and you have built a website. There comes a basic authentication along with the creation of the Laravel Project. Now, if you are required to check if the incoming HTTP request is authenticated, then which of the following PHP commands can be executed in this scenario?

Tara is working on her Laravel application. She wants to store information about the user across the HTTP requests so she has implemented sessions. If she is required to store the user data in the session with respect to a key-value pair, then which of the following PHP commands can she implement in this scenario:

PHP commands

1.

$request->session->store('key','value');

2.

$request->session->create('key','value');

3.

$request->session()->put('key','value');

4.

$request->session()->set('key','value');

Bob is working on the Laravel framework for his PHP web-based project. He is required to create cookies to work on the user's session in his web application. He has created a cookie. If his cookie is required to be attached with his HTTP response, which of the following methods should he implement in this scenario?

What is the output of the following PHP code:


  <?php
    $a = 30;
    $b = 20;
     function output()
     {
       $b = $GLOBALS['a'] + $GLOBALS['b'];
     } 
    output();
    echo $b;
  ?>

What is the output of the following PHP code:


   <?php
       echo hex2bin("436f64657221");
   ?>

What is the output of the following PHP code:


   <?php
       echo stripos("programming is my passion, i work for my passion","passion"); 
   ?>

What is the output of the following PHP code:


  <?php
   function val1($num)
   {
     $num += 5;
   }

   function val2($num)
  {
    $num += 6;
  }
   $num = 10;
   val1( $num );
   echo "First value is  $num<br />";
   val2( $num );
   echo "Second value is $num<br />";
  ?>

a.option:
First value is 10
Second value is 10

First value is 15
Second value is 16

First value is 10
Second value is 15

First value is 10
Second value is 16

q: Which of the following functions displays the information about PHP?

What is the output of the following PHP code:



<?php
   $x = "1";
   $x = 1;
   $y = 1;
     switch($x)
        {
          case $x * $y: 
              print "php";
              break;
          case $x / $y:
              print "html";
              break;
          default:
              print "phphtml";
        }
     ?>
